title: Attack on Ilhan Omar Follows Years of Trump’s Targeting Her
summary: President Trump has spent years demonizing and dehumanizing the Somali-born Democrat from Minnesota, fueling escalating threats against her.

title: Who Is the Man That Attacked Ilhan Omar at a Town Hall in Minneapolis?
summary: Anthony J. Kazmierczak frequently posted online about conservative issues. He told a neighbor that he was going to get arrested at an event hosted by Ms. Omar.

title: Why the NORAD Cold War Pact Between the U.S. and Canada Is News
summary: The State Department clarified comments made by the U.S. Ambassador to Canada that NORAD would be “altered” if that country did not purchase American F-35 jets.

title: Fed Holds Rates Steady as It Points to an Improving Economy
summary: The Federal Reserve chose to pause rate cuts, even as it faces relentless attacks from President Trump for not cutting borrowing costs fast enough.

summary: The Trump administration has unleashed a barrage of attacks on the Federal Reserve, including a criminal investigation into its chair, Jerome H. Powell.

summary: U.S. and European officials say they have put three demands in front of the Iranians, including a permanent end to all enrichment of uranium.

title: Man Sentenced to 15 Years for Role in Plot to Kill Iranian Dissident
summary: Carlisle Rivera became the third person to be sentenced for playing a role in trying to kill Masih Alinejad, an activist and a critic of the Iranian government.

title: Who Will Win the Best Actor Oscar?
summary: In an exceptionally strong field, Timothée Chalamet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Ethan Hawke, Michael B. Jordan and Wagner Moura each have a way to triumph.

title: Tens of Thousands in Tennessee, Mississippi and Louisiana Without Power After Storm
summary: Across Tennessee, Mississippi and Louisiana, hundreds of power lines and poles remained damaged after freezing rain and low temperatures coated much of the region in ice over the weekend.

title: Most N.Y.C. Storm Victims Believed to Have Died After Cold Exposure
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani said that seven of the 10 people who died during the cold weather showed signs of cold exposure. One man was found dead just steps from a hospital.

title: Did a Luxury Nursing Home Hold a 91-Year-Old Woman Captive?
summary: Her memory was failing, and the $28,000-a-month assisted living facility wouldn’t let her leave. Was it protecting her from an untrustworthy guardian?

title: Sergey Brin Spends $20 Million on California Political Effort Amid Wealth Tax Debate
summary: Sergey Brin donated $20 million to a new political drive aimed at solving California’s housing crisis, spurring other billionaires to pitch in. Their efforts may also help ward off a wealth tax.

summary: Politically pointed and heavy on his Jewish faith, the book already has Democrats talking.

summary: That would be a major jump from $72 billion last year, as the tech giant aims to compete in the artificial intelligence race.

title: Microsoft Continues to Spend Big on A.I. While Profit Jumps 60%
summary: The company said on Wednesday that revenue in the most recent quarter was $81.3 billion, but its share price dropped more than 5 percent in after-hours trading.

title: Camping on Thwaites Glacier
summary: After working and camping for a week on Thwaites Glacier, scientists were ready to start drilling into the ice, if only the weather would let them.

title: Landslide Leaves Town in Sicily Perched on a Cliff’s Edge
summary: “We are in a movie, in a horror film,” said a resident of Niscemi, where a widening chasm is threatening the town’s historic center.

summary: The man, now 44, said he was repeatedly sexually abused when he was a child at a school in Newark in the 1990s.

title: Chinese National Heng Guan Who Documented Uyghurs’ Repression Wins Asylum
summary: Heng Guan, a Chinese national, will not be released immediately, as Homeland Security said it was reserving the right to appeal.
